paper_metadata.title: Deriving a Poverty-Efficient Allocation of Aid

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: We first utilize new World Bank ratings of twenty different aspects of national policy to establish the current relationship between aid, policies and growth. Onto this we add a mapping from growth to poverty reduction
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: This paper derives a poverty-efficient allocation of aid and compares it with actual aid allocations

bonus_information.cost_mentions: Cost per person lifted out of poverty calculations
bonus_information.cost_evidence_citation: If the present global flow of aid were efficiently allocated, the marginal cost of lifting a person permanently above the $2 per day threshold would be $1,626
